page.title: 18ARTS AND CRAFTS IN NEWHAVEN
page.content: Arts and crafts are popular in Newhaven: the majority of students at the Adult Education Centre take these courses. Local schools teach art and pottery. Joan Dove, a potter who teaches at the Education Centre, believes that teapots are the most saleable items of local pottery, although she also produces glazed pots, mugs and enamelled necklaces. Myrta Fisher, a professional artist and teacher, who often exhibits locally, finds that although she paints a variety of subjects the local favourites are landscapes. Miss Fisher favours the use of watercolours rather than oils, following the tradition of this area, which has been renowned for watercolourists since the early eighteenth century. Crafts practised include macrame, embroidery, crochet and the making of corn dollies
